Key Match Events: Mohammed Shami picked up a five-wicket haul in his first match at this World Cup.
Mark Wood was bowled by Jasprit Bumrah for 0.
Pre-Game Insights: India were unbeaten with five wins in as many matches before the game.
England had just one win from five matches and were near the bottom of the points table.
Rohit Sharma was setting the tone in the powerplay, striking at 134.01.
Jasprit Bumrah had an economy of 2.90 in the first ten overs.
India were without Hardik Pandya due to an ankle injury.
Mohammed Siraj was among the most lethal ODI bowlers coming into the World Cup with 30 wickets in 14 matches in 2023.
Jos Buttler had scored only 95 runs in five innings at this World Cup.
India were likely to play an unchanged XI.
England were likely to bring in Gus Atkinson for Mark Wood.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a red-soil pitch with light patches of grass, favoring seamers.
The temperature in the afternoon was around 31°C, dropping by five degrees in the evening.
Virat Kohli was one short of equalling Sachin Tendulkar's record of most ODI hundreds.
Shreyas Iyer was 69 runs away from 2000 ODI runs.
If Buttler scored 82 runs, he would become the joint second-fastest Englishman to 5000 ODI runs.
Shami had dismissed Buttler five times in 60 balls, more than any other bowler in ODIs.
Jonny Bairstow averaged 13.25 against Ravindra Jadeja in ODIs, with four dismissals in six innings.
Others: KL Rahul mentioned that every player has a different role and they are playing their role and responsibility well.
England assistant coach Marcus Trescothick played down the idea that England had lost interest in ODIs.
